meanings.sent1: Grandma always forespeaks the weather by looking at the sky.
meanings.sent2: The fortune teller forespeaks events that will happen in the future.
meanings.sent3: The cat forespeaks the arrival of visitors by meowing at the door.
meanings.sent4: The old clock on the wall seems to forespeak the passage of time with each tick.
meanings.sent5: The ancient book was said to forespeak the rise and fall of kingdoms.

meanings.definition: To speak beforehand or in advance.
meanings.sent1: The teacher always forespeaks the topics for the next class.
meanings.sent2: The CEO forespeaks the company's plans in the upcoming meeting.
meanings.sent3: The parrot forespeaks the words it will say later in the day.
meanings.sent4: The alarm clock seems to forespeak the start of a new day every morning.
meanings.sent5: The wise elder forespeaks advice to the young ones before they make decisions.
